translation.value: Yes, I want to leave this level.
Yes, I want to delete this savegame.
Yes, I want to load a previously saved game.
Focus Camera on the Dark Mother
FPS Limit When Game is not in Focus
That key has already been assigned.
Enable Cursor Clipping (Only available in Windowed Mode)
Enter Menu When the Game is not in Focus

Early access warning: This game is still in alpha, early access state. You might encounter bugs. You might encounter crashes and you might get frustrated. If possible, report all issues you find to the Dwelvers forum and we will solve it asap!
This is an enemy creature, details are unknown.
Your creature is sleepy. Make sure there are enough Beds available.
Your creature is hungry. Make sure there is enough Food at the Bar.
Your creature is thirsty. Make sure there is enough Beer at the Bar.
Make sure there is an empty bed available where your creature can rest and regain health.
This is an enemy building, details are unknown.
You can either fetch the liquid or build a bridge over it.
Click on the liquid to order Imps to fetch it.
Either build a mine or dig in this area to obtain minerals.
Reinforce walls to make it harder for enemies to dig through them.
Sells a building. You will only get some of the building materials back.
Opens a menu with wall constructions to build.
Opens a menu with floor constructions to build.
Opens a menu with nature objects to build.
Opens a menu with castle objects.
Opens a menu with minerals to add.
Opens a menu with minerals to remove.
Opens a menu with creatures to add.
Opens a menu with items for this trading post trade with.
Link or unlink rooms to change their delivery paths.
Manually activates or deactivates a building.
Kill creature and make use of its remains.
Feed creature to Dark Mother to get a mana boost.
Opens a menu with rooms to build.
Opens a menu with Bar Room buildings.
Opens a menu with Bedroom buildings.
Opens a menu with Cookery Room buildings.
Opens a menu with catacombs room buildings.
Opens a menu with farm room buildings.
Opens a menu with crafting room buildings.
Opens a menu with prison room buildings.
Opens a menu with storage room buildings.
Opens a menu with training room buildings.
Opens a menu with trading room buildings.
Opens a menu with actions to perform on liquids.
Order your Imps to drop a Water Block on a tile.
Order your Imps to drop a Lava Block on a tile.
Fetch a Water or Lava Block to place in storage.
Builds a road to connect your rooms and increase your creatures' travel speed.
Upgrade a road to increase your creatures' travel speed.
Shows details about the selected room.
Opens a menu with traps and constructions to keep the ememy out.
Trading will take place between trading rooms and claimed portals. The more portals owned, the more trading options will be available.
If more than %s2 units of %s1 are stored, then start selling %s1 for gold.
If less than %s2 units of %s1 are stored, then start buying %s1 for gold.
No trading conditions have been set for %s1.
Let slip the bulls of war
Spawn at least five Cyclotaur creatures.
Conquer at least five human-spawning portals in the dungeon.
Catch a fish by building a bridge out to a school of fish.
Unlock and build all room types.
Make a trade with another colony.
Level up an Impanzee to learn the creature skill Barrel Roll.
Level up a Cyclotaur to learn the creature skill Bull Rush.
Level up a Piggeh to learn the creature skill Butchering.
Level up a Fishman to learn the creature skill Frog Tongue.
Level up a Knight to learn the creature skill Hurricane.
Level up a Rogue to learn the creature skill Steal.
Level up an Orc to learn the creature skill Stunning Block.
Level up an Imp to learn the creature skill Teleport.
Shows what race this creature belongs to.
Shows the level of this creature and how much experience is needed before the creature reaches the next level.
Shows the efficiency this creature currently has. A low efficiency will lower the creature's damage, defense, and resistance. The efficiency is affected if the creature's needs are satisfied.
Shows the damage this creature can do per second. The value shown is the attack speed multiplied with the damage.
Shows the defense this creature currently has. A high defense will help the creature withstand physical attacks.
Shows the resistance this creature currently has. A high resistance will help the creature withstand elemental attacks.
Shows the health this creature currently has. If the health reaches zero they will become unconscious. If they don't get to a bed they will die.
Shows how well-rested this creature currently is. If rest value gets too low, the creature's efficiency will be affected. If this is not addressed, they will turn against you.

Shows how full the creature is. If the creature gets too hungry, the creature's efficiency will be affected. If they don't get food, eventually they will turn against you. Feeding the creature its favorite food will increase the creature's efficiency.
This creature doesn't have any favorite food.
Shows how drunk this creature currently is. If the creature starts sobering up, the creature's efficiency will be affected. Keeping them sober too long will make them turn against you.
Shows what the creature is currently doing.
I hope you liked playing Dwelvers.
If you want to support the development of this game, and want to
be able to play the full version you can visit www.dwelvers.com
Dwelvers is a game that is being continuously updated. By pre-ordering the game, you will receive all
future updates and help us reach our goal to make Dwelvers the game it deserves to be!
Your crafting skills increased to level %s1
Your spell skills increased to level %s1
This area is unexplored. Its details are unknown.
Click on the quickicon to make a swap.
Here you see the Dark Mother's health. If it drops below zero you will loose the game!
(Left-click to zoom in on the Dark Mother)
Torturing enemies in prison or destroying human buildings on the surface world will feed the evil meter.
Mana is required to cast spells. To increase your mana regeneration you need to feed the evil meter.
This shows the average health of all your creatures.
This shows the average mood of all your creatures which is based on the fulfillment of thier needs.
This shows how much storage you have available.
This shows your average productivity in the dungeon.
The time left until the next enemy wave descends through the portals.
Wave stopped, you need to conquer more portals.
Shows how many creatures of this type are idle.
Shows how many creatures of this type are resting.
Shows how many creatures of this type are working.
Shows how many creatures of this type are fighting.
Shows how many creatures of this type are unconscious.
Shows how many creatures of this type are angry.
Shows how many creatures of this type are unhappy.
Shows how many creatures of this type are happy.
Shows the percentage of spawning requirements that have been meet.
Items left to produce in the %s1: %s2/%s3
Place to rally all creatures that can fight to the flag
Place to rally all creature of this type to the flag.
Place to rally the squad to the flag.
Left click to zoom in on location.
Left click to switch between the surface world and the dungeon world. Only available after portals have been conquered.
Warns when battle has broken out. Left click on it to zoom in on active battles.
Warns when there are issues in the production chain. Left click on it to zoom in on active issues.
Warns when creatures don't get their needs fulfilled. Left click on it to zoom in on unhappy creatures.
Your spell level is too low
This spell is beyond your knowledge. Increase your spell level to learn this spell.
Glowing mushrooms left to harvest before level up: %s1
You have reached maximum spell level.
Harvesting glowing mushrooms increases your spell level. The higher spell level you have the more spells you will be able to cast.
Items left to craft before level up: %s1
You have reached maximum crafting level.

Crafting enough items will increase your crafting level. The higher level you have the more equipments you can craft. But note that some equipment must be found in the dungeon before you can learn how to craft them.
You can supply %s1 units, and your creatures demands %s2 units.
Left-click to add to crafting queue
Right-click to remove from crafting queue
This item is owned but can not be crafted, increase your crafting level to make this item craftable.
This item is not craftable without a 'Forge and Anvil'.
This item is not craftable without a 'Sewing Machine'.
This item type is being stored
This item type is being moved to another storage room
There are no other storage rooms that can store this item type

By left clicking on an item type you can decide whether or not you want to store the items of this type. If there are no other storage rooms that can store these items, then your take out of storage request will be ignored.
This item type is being produced
This item type is not being produced
By left clicking on an item type you can decide whether you want the production of this item type to be enabled or not.
Left click to stop storing items in this storage room. If there are no other storage rooms that can store these items, then your request to stop storing these items is ignored.
Left click to start storing items in this storage room.
You can buy %s1 %s2 for %s3 %s4, or buy %s5 %s6 for %s7 %s8.

Here you can set the creature types equipment priority. If a creature type have an higher equipment priority than another, then the creatures of this type will get the first choice of the best equipment.
Feed enemies to the Dark Mother.
Your steel ingot production is getting slow. To produce steel ingot you need coal and iron delivered to the steel smelter.
Your flour production is getting slow. To produce flour you need to grind antroots. Check your antroot production in the farmland.

Your antroot production is getting slow. The antroots in your farmland need water to grow so make sure that you have a well nearby that your workers can fetch water from. Depending on the size of your farm, you may need more than one.
Your beer production is getting slow. To brew beer you need water and antroots delivered to the brewing vat.
Your bread production is getting slow. To bake bread you need water and flour delivered to the baking table, and have coal available to get the oven burning.
Your barbecue production is getting slow. To barbecue you need fish or mice, and coal to be delivered to the barbecue.

This twisted root vegetable can be grown and harvested in the farmland in the farm room. It is perfect for underground farming as it only requires water and doesn't need any sunlight. It can be used to brew beer or make flour for bread.
Low storage warning. Grow more antroots in the farm land.
A standard barbarian axe made from steel and wood. It is heavy to wield but has high damage.
A standard barbarian shield made from steel, wood, and bone. It is very heavy despite its small size, and those who are able to wield it enjoy its high block chance.
A standard barbarian sword made from steel and wood. While lighter than the axe, it has lower damage due to its poor quality.
Brewed in the cookery room, this sweet beer is made from water and antroot. Have your Imps serve the beer in the bar to raise the alcohol level of your dungeon drunks and make them happy.
Low storage warning. Brew more beers in the cookery room.
A twisted sword that delivers unexpected attacks against even the most experienced of foes.
A piece of bone obtainable from enemies and butchered animals. It is mainly used as a crafting material.
Low storage warning. Obtain more bones by killing enemies.
This bone armor is made out of bone and rope, and can resist strong attacks. It is favored for use in battle as its appearance strikes fear into the hearts of enemies.
This bone axe is made out of bone and rope. Its weak damage is proof that bones should not be used for weapon making.

A simple dish for many, but down here in the darkness it is a delicacy. This bread is produced at a baking table in the cookery room using flour and water. Serve it at the bar to still the hunger of your minions so they may continue to work and do your bidding.
Low storage warning. Bake more bread in the cookery room.
Ammunition for your cannon traps. Highly effective weapons when aimed at the right target!
Low storage warning. Craft more cannon balls in the crafting room.
Once a useful tool for butchering animals, now a weapon with a similar purpose against our enemies.
A lump of fossilized carbon that is used primary as fuel and crafting. This mineral is easy to find as it can be mined out of every layer in the dungeon.
Low storage warning. Mine more coal.

It's no surprise your Fishmen are extremely adept at catching fish as long as they have something sturdy to stand on. Build a bridge out to a school of fish and the Fishmen will dive in and catch a fish. Barbecue it and serve it in the bar to still your minions' hunger.
Low storage warning. Build a bridge out to a school of fish to catch more fish.
This flour is ground from antroots in the mill in the farm room. Use it to bake bread in the cookery room.
Low storage warning. Grind more flour in the farm room.

A dense, malleable, and ductile metal with an attractive bright yellow color and luster that is maintained without tarnishing in air or water. To find gold you will need to dig deep and take advantage of the natural cliff formations in the dungeon.
Low storage warning. Mine more gold.
A simple hide armor that provides light protection. Can be worn by almost all creatures.

Along with coal, iron is one of the most common elements found in the dungeon. It is rarely seen at the surface, but is not hiding too far below. As it is contaminated by dirt and rock, it must be purified in the steel smelter in the crafting room before use.
Low storage warning. Mine more iron.
An armor made out of steel, rope, and leather. It has a high defense but is very heavy. Only the strongest creatures are able to wear it and take advantage of its benefits.
A simple fist weapon made out of steel and wood that delivers devastating punches to enemies.
Made out of iron and coal in the steel smelter at the crafting room. It has been cast into a suitable shape for further processing, and is mostly used as a crafting material for weapons.
Low storage warning. Make more steel ingot in the crafting room.
This mighty two-handed weapon is primarily crafted for human Knights, and used to keep the threat of the underworld at bay.
Low storage warning. Fetch lava blocks from lava lakes.
A piece of leather gathered from dead animals and creatures.
Low storage warning. Kill more enemies to get more leather.
A simple leather armor that brings some protection against enemy attacks. Can be worn by almost any creature.
A live mouse that can be used in the farm mill wheel.
Low storage warning. Build more mouse traps to capture more mice.
A tool used by peasants for harvesting the land. Can also be used as weapon if nothing better comes along.
Crispy. Serve it at the bar to still your minions' hunger.
Low storage warning. Roast more fishes in the cookery room.
A very dead mouse. Serve it at the bar to still your minions' hunger.
Low storage warning. Roast more mice in the cookery room.

The underworld contains plenty of rock. In fact, you should keep a close eye on your storage capacity as you start digging out your underground lair. Use your excess rock supply to build decorations or sell it on the market.
Low storage warning. Mine more rock.
Rope made of strong fibers gathered when chopping roots. It is mainly used as a crafting material.
Low storage warning. Mine more roots to get more rope.
Despite its simple appearance, a very dangerous weapon in the hands of an agitated wielder. It is made out of wood, rope and steel.
Deep underneath the bedrock lie vast lakes of groundwater. Build wells in your dungeon for endless supplies of cool, fresh water for all your farming and manufacturing needs.
Low storage warning. Build more wells to fetch more water.
Low storage warning. Fetch water blocks from lakes.

Not many thought that it would be possible to harvest wood in a dungeon. As it turns out, great trees are growing on the surface and their roots stretch far down through the dungeon cracks. Order your minions to harvest the roots to obtain invaluable wood to build useful constructions in your dungeon.
Low storage warning. Mine more roots to get more wood.
This wooden club is a stick with a rock on it. A primitive yet effective killing tool.
A simple wooden shield which gives the wearer some block chance. It is very cheap to produce, but can save a life.
Digs deep into the ground to build its nests near the bedrock.
A mythical creature with the strength of a bull and the depth perception of a cyclops.
An excellent spelunker who gathers minerals for their kingdom above.
Half man, half fish (and probably has half a brain). A sneaky creature that fears nothing.
A little green tireless creature that keeps your dungeon in working order.
A territorial mutant, believed to be part Imp and part Chimpanzee.
A human frontline warrior, known for their stamina and devastating sweeping attacks.
A fierce warrior whose bloodlust is matched by their drive to work metal, and cleave through rock with their pickaxe.
The peasants spend their days out on the fields gathering food for the kingdom.
The soldier is a mindless tool for the human ruling class
A strong creature with a passion for cooking (and eating).
A greedy little creature with a knack for haggling. Just don't turn your back on them...
You don't have enough mana to cast this spell.
Teleport creatures to their traveling destination.
Extract minerals from a mineral vein. The amount of minerals you extract depends on the value of the mineral. This is done without changing the mineral amount in the vein.
Creates a gravity field that sucks in all creatures.
Tucks and rolls to nearest enemy stunning it briefly.
Charge like a bull through enemy crowds. Tear their limbs apart and don't stop until something solid has been hit.
Employs inherent butchering skills to strike down enemies at close range.
Attaches a long sticky tongue on the enemy and pull him back to the caster.
Swirl a two-handed weapon around hitting all enemies that come too close.
Gives the creature swift fingers making him able to steal the enemy's equipment.
Enemies that get blocked also get stunned.
As long as nothing is being carried one can enter the forth dimension and instantly disappear from one place and appear in another.
The Dark Mother works as the headquarters for your dungeon. New minions are spawned here.
A portal that connects the surface world to the dungeon.
A continuous source of fresh water.
A place for your creatures to eat and drink.
Your minions sleep here to regain health and energy.
A road that enables faster transportation. It can be upgraded 2 times.
A reinforced wall that takes a long time to dig through.
A room where food and drinks are made.
Here is where the farming takes place.
A resting place for the dead.
Concentrate your defense by building Guard Rooms.
Remnants of a room that has been taken over by Impanzees.
A standard seamless floor used in mazes to confuse intruders.
A solid maze wall that can not be dug through.
A room for crafting materials and making equipments.
Needed to keep your enemies in place.
A solid rock wall that can not be dug through.
A tribute to the vigorous Impanzees.
A tribute to the fierce Orcs.
Items stored here will be claimed as yours.
Used for trading goods with other colonies.
Prepare your minions for future battles.
A bridge with an arc-shaped appearance.
A cozy fireplace designed for the bedroom.
All chests are filled with items and treasure that your Imps can claim.
A baking table used for making bread.
Used for barbecuing fish and delicious mouse meat.
Wall barrels to decorate the cookery room.
An ordinary wall torch that lights up your dungeon.
This wooden door will slightly delay an invasion and protect your dungeon so that you can rally your defenses.
Farmland used for growing and harvesting antroot.
Can be cooked and served once caught.
Produces weapons and armor using steel and other resources.
A gate that leads into the graveyard.
A barrel used for storage in the Dark Mother room.
Fires a flaming cannonball at nearby enemy. Requires cannonballs as ammunition.
Every time pressure reaches the counter, it will switch on or off to control the pressure.
Gives off a gigantic explosion that destroys nearby walls and foes (or unfortunate minions) when receiving pressure.
Gives pressure in one direction unless it gets pressure from another.
Excellent for trapping enemies and killing them off.
Used to transport pressure between the different hydraulic constructions.
When stepped on by an enemy, it will deliver pressure to its surroundings.
Enables pressure in only one direction. Very good for creating loops.
An switch that turns the pressure on and off.
Produces steel ingots from coal and iron ore.
Prison bars made for keeping your enemies locked in.
A floor torch made from a detached arm.
A wall torch made from a skull.
A good practice target for your melee fighters.
Produces clothing out of rope and leather.
A stone bridge that can resist lava.
A corner shelf for storing items on.
A cross table for storing items on.
A round table for storing items on.
A shelf for storing items on.
A square table for storing items on.
A wall shelf for storing items on.
A loading dock used for trading with other colonies.
An ordinary wooden bridge that keeps the creatures from falling into the water.
A ladder that enables your creatures to reach new heights.
A place for your minions to sit down for a meal and some ale.
A bed designed for Cyclotaurs only.
A bed designed for Fishmen only.
A bed designed for Imps only.
A bed designed for Impanzees only.
A bed designed for Orcs only.
A bed designed for Piggehs only.
The light flickers along the dark dungeon walls.
A patch of magical glowing mushrooms.
A war insignia to decorate the dungeon.
Build on a mineral vein to extract more minerals but during a longer timespan.
A colorful painting that can decorate one of your dungeon walls.
A pine tree that can be chopped down to obtain wood.
A solid fence designed to keep intruders at bay.
Can be chopped down to obtain wood.
An simple wall lantern that lights up your dark dungeon.
Decorate your dungeon with torture tools to show your creatures who is boss.
A castle wall with a window.
A castle wall with a banner.
Castle wall with a weapons of arms
A castle wall with a weapons of arms.
A block made out of marble. Often used in throne rooms.
A throne for kings to rule on.
A royal bed usually found in castles.
A nice looking vase usually found in castles.
A nice looking reeling usually found in castles.
Kill all enemies in the dungeon and on the surface to win. Enemies left to kill: %s1.
Kill all enemies on the surface to win. Enemies left to kill: %s1.
Kill all enemies in the dungeon to win. Enemies left to kill: %s1.
Kill %s1 enemies to win. Enemies killed: %s2 / %s1.
Take over all portals to win. Portals taken over: %s2 / %s1.
Take over %s1 portals to win. Portals taken over: %s2 / %s1.
Reach spell level %s1 to win. Spell level reached: %s2 / %s1.
Reach crafting level %s1 to win. Crafting level reached: %s2 / %s1.
Ah, the countryside. It's awash with joy and happiness on this glorious morning, all bathed in sunshine and smiles.
Its enough to make you sick!
Well now, up and at em warden. Your guiding hand is needed if we are to show these blissful saps the error of their ways.

I command you to build an army to lay waste to those who stand above us. They are arrogant in their belief that they are the goodly, righteous, and in control. They are unaware that we are the true masters of this world
You will only have Piggehs and Imps join your dungeon for now.
Imps are your main laborers and will do most any job in the dungeon.
Piggehs only work in the Cookery and can be called to battle, although they are in no hurry to get anywhere.
The bar room should be your first construction. But first you must dig out an area before you place the bar.
Great job! Now your creatures will have somewhere to sit while they stuff their faces.
They can only stuff their greedy faces if they have food. The main ingredients for food are made in the farm room. You don't have a farm room... so get building a farm room!
Oh good! Now we have farmland where we can grow antroot. Next we need to build a mill to grind the roots and make flour.
As you may have noticed no antroots are growing in the farm land, this is because we don't have water.
A well should be placed somewhere close to the farmland, why don't you sell a piece of the farm room and build the well there?
Have you noticed the mouse infestation in the dungeon? Mice are a good source of protein, Imps love to eat them. Construct a mouse trap and Imps will place antroot to draw them in.
Wonderful! Now you are able to produce water, antroot , flour and mice. All that's needed now is a cookery, so Piggehs can prepare the food.
Now that your creatures can fill their bellies, they'll need a place to sleep or exhausted creatures will have your head. Better build them a bed room or else there could be a revolt.
I can see that your creatures can't reach the excavation area. Build a gate on the farm land so that they can pass through.
Now build three beds for each type of creature. These beds are not only for sleeping, but also where your creatures can go to heal after battle.
Good work! Now it is finally time to build the cookery.
To be able to start producing food and beer, you need to build a baking table, a barbecue, and a brewing vat.
Let's not get too pleased with ourselves. You've shown you can provide the basic needs for any dungeon, but you've yet to see combat. Let's see if you are ready to face those humans...
Dig out the flashing area by selecting it with the left mouse button.
Right-click over the area you just dug out. This will open the radial menu where you get the option to build a bar room. Build the bar room by dragging the hammer over the flashing area.
Now open the radial menu in the newly built bar room and select to build a bar table. Build it on the location that is pointed out for you.
Dig out the flashing area and build a farm room in the newly excavated area.
Open the radial menu in the farm room and select to build farm land. Build it on the location that is pointed out for you.
Now build a mill at the location that is pointed out for you.
Make Room for Building a Well
Open the radial menu and choose the sell option. Sell the farm land at the location that is pointed out for you and then build a well in its place.
Build a mouse trap at the location that is pointed out for you.
Dig out the flashing area and build a bed room in the newly excavated area.
Open the radial menu over the farm land and select to build a farm land gate. Place it in the location that is pointed out for you.
Build three Piggeh beds and three Imp beds in the newly built bedroom.
Dig out the flashing area and build a cookery room in the newly excavated area.
Build a baking table, a barbecue, and a brewing vat in the newly built cookery room.
Train your creatures and kill your enemies.
Warden, with all your digging and building, its likely to draw the attention of those mirthful, mindless, meat bags on the surface.
Portals connect the underside with the surface world, but their locations are many, and are scattered about the land.
Its not known exactly where they are, but its certain you should get to work preparing for battle.
Since we built the brewing vat we have been getting some Impanzees to help us in our cause.
But our army needs to grow and become stronger before we attack.
Start with building some beds to the Impanzees.
Very good! All we need now is a training room, but to build a training room we need steel which is forged in the crafting room.
Build a crafting room with a steel smelter inside it.
Ah, look at that. The iron smelter attracted an Orc. These creatures loves to work, so perhaps we shouldn't be that surprised.
Build them a couple of Orc beds.
Now it is time to build a training room with a couple of punching pigs inside it.
Look at your creatures train and grow stronger. They are soon strong enough to face your enemies.
A key strategy in battle is that all your creatures attack at once. You can achieve this with the rally flag.
Click on the rally flag icon and place it somewhere in the dungeon where your creatures can reach it.
Very good! Now you can see all your creatures gather around the rally flag you put out.
But as there are no enemies around you can cancel the rally flag by right-clicking on its icon again.
Great job! Now you know how to gather your forces when a battle occur.
So now it is high time to leave your comfort zone.
Start by digging out the area highlighted if you haven't done so already and build a bridge over the water.
The humans should be located nearby, keep digging until you find them!
Look at that! You found an impanzee lair, these impanzees are wild and will never follow you!
Use the rally flag to gather your forces and crush the impanzees!
This wall seems to be human made, we are getting close!
Use the rally flag to gather your creatures and attack the wall.
We have finally found the portal leading up to the surface world. Now attack it!
With the portal destroyed the humans can't enter the dungeon. But we can enter the surface!
Click on the surface button next to the minimap to see the surface world.
Now use the rally flag to find and kill all the humans on the surface!
Very good job! All the humans are now killed!
But remember that these humans were very weak. There will be stronger enemies in the future!
Therefore as a next step I will teach you how to craft weapons and armor that your creatures can equip...
Build two impanzee beds in the bed room.
Build a crafting room that are at least 9 tiles big.
Build a iron smelter inside the crafting room.
Build two orc beds in the bed room.
Build a 9 tiles big training room.
Build three punching pigs in the training room.
Click on the flashing rally flag and drop it somewhere in the dungeon.
Cancel the rally flag by right clicking on the red flashing rally flag icon.
Dig out the flashing area and build bridges over the water. You can also build rock on the water to get over.
Dig and explore the dungeon until you find the humans.
Gather your forces with the rally flag and kill the impanzees.
Attack and destroy the human made wall with the help of the rally flag.
Use the rally flag to rally your creatures to the surface and kill all the humans.
Equip your creatures and expand your dungeon with efficiency.
The human threat is getting stronger now that we have made our presence known to them.
Therefore you need to start crafting equipment for your creatures.
But first you need to build a substainable dungeon where your creatures can eat, drink and sleep.
There are a lot of water flowing through your dungeon that needs to be removed before we start building.
You can use the fetch water tool for this, or just build rocks on top of the water to flatten the ground.
As minerals can be scarce in the dungeon you may want to get the most out of the mining process as possible.
If you build a mine on a mineral vein you will be able to mine more minerals out of the rock than if you just mined it all at once.
The only downside is that it will take longer time to get the minerals.
Ah, look at that school of fish! Build a bridge next to it to attract a fishman which will help you with the fishing.
Some heights takes to long to reach with rock building. Save yourself some time and build a ladder instead.
The farther you get from your base the longer your creatures will have to carry their loot.
If you build storage rooms along the way your creatures can unload their loot much faster.
Now that you have longer distances to travel you could build some roads to speed up the transportation as well.
Now when your dungeon is working as it should we can start focusing on equiping your creatures.
Build a forge and anvil and a sewing machine in the crafting room.
Very good! You are now able to craft equipments for your creatures.
Start by crafting three wooden clubs. You can do this by clicking on the wooden clubs in the crafting menu.
Now that your creatures can equip themselves you will see that they are a lot better in battle.
But three wooden clubs are not enough, make more weapons and armor to make sure that all your creatures are equiped.
You now also have the option to decide which creature type should get the best equipment. This can be done in the creatures menu.
When you feel ready you can start exploring both dungeon and surface searching for those human meatbags, you need to find and kill them all!
I am very impressed! I see that you are quick learner.
Now that we have killed so many of the humans I suspect they are getting very eager to start attacking us.
But we will stand prepared! Next up we will build guard rooms and learn how to make squads.
Build a mouse trap and a well.
Build a bed room that all creatures can use.
Build a large enough training room.
Build a forge and anvil and a sewing machine in the crafting room.
Build a storage room with three round storage tables inside it.
The humans are probably hiding both in the dungeon and on the surface. Find and kill them all!
Create squads, build prisons and use magic.
There is a prince on surface that has promised his king he will eradicate us.
Well, I say we show him real evil!
Find and kill the prince before he kills you.
There are four portals down here in the dungeon, it's a good idea to find them all and conquer them before you start searching for the prince on the surface.
As long as there are portals owned by the enemy, they will keep on attacking you. And their attacks will get stronger and stronger.
This is a good time to learn how to use squads so that you can divide your forces and not attack with all of them at once.
We have found ourselves in a treacherous dungeon filled with lava and enemies.
It is extremely important that you advance with caution. Make your army strong before you venture to far into the dungeon.
We have found some glowing mushrooms which enhances your spell casting abilities, the more mushrooms you harvest and I eat the more spells you will be able to cast.
The prison is also a torture chamber. Torturing your enemies will grow your evil and make you stronger.
You can kill imprisoned enemies to make use of their remains, or feed them too me for a mana boost.
Why don't we start by feeding me one of those humans.
Mmmm, crunchy human... That should have given you a mana boost strong enough to try out the reveal spell.
Well done! Now you can see how this magic can come in handy when exploring the dungeon.
Now lets see if you are able to create and use squads.
Perfect! Now lets get this dungeon up to order so that we can start planning our attacks.
Now that is what I call evil at its finest.
Well done killing that prince. The surface king will never let this go unpunished.
But that is all according too plan, we will make him angry so that he will come too us.
Right-click on a imprisoned enemy and feed it to the Dark Mother.
Select the reveal spell from the spell menu and cast it on an undiscovered area.

Create a squad in the creatures menu by selecting a squad id and then select the creatures you want to add too that squad. Finish by placing the newly created squad rally flag somewhere in the dungeon.
Find and kill the human prince that resides on the surface.
Build traps and raise ghosts to join your fight.
Pathetic humans! Don't they know that nothing can penetrate our defenses.
It seems like the human King is getting angry with us and have started attacking us more frequently.
But to our defense we have now have cannons and guardrooms, and the guard room attracts Cyclotaurs.
This time your main goal is to find all the human owned portals in the dungeon and destroy them.
You are now also able to build catacombs rooms which is a resting place for the dead. Bring dead creatures here and they will be resurrected as ghosts.
These ghosts will attack enemies nearby, but they will not listen to any rally commands.
Is it just me or do you also hear a waterfall nearby? Could be a good place to catch fishes and spawn fishmen.
Good luck killing those humans, and remember not to wait too long before you start destroying portals or you will get overrun by enemies.
Good job! All the portals are now destroyed and the humans can no longer attack us.
Now it is our turn to hit the humans where it hurts the most...
Find and destroy all human owned portals, the longer you wait the stronger the enemy will become.
